responses.content:
She appears from the reed wall like a thing born of it — tall for a hobgoblin, milky eye catching the grey light, longbow half-drawn. The snake-bone necklace rattles once.

She sees Crandurth. Sees the blood on it — Skratha's blood, still dark on the steel. Her one good eye widens.

The bow comes up.

Crandurth comes down.

The elder folds where she stands. The longbow drops into the water. The necklace breaks, vertebrae scattering across the mire like dice thrown by a careless god. She sinks to her knees in the mud, and the mud accepts her, and the black water rises around her shoulders like a burial shroud woven by the swamp itself.

Valania says nothing for a long moment. Then: 'That was a clan elder. The necklace — leadership markings. Bloodswamp don't have many of those.'

She crouches, recovers the longbow from the shallows. Good sinew. Good wood. Worth keeping or worth leaving as a message — your choice.

'The Bloodswamp helped found Gammaria,' Valania says quietly. Not accusation. Observation. The kind she makes when she wants you to think about what you've done without her having to say so.

Somewhere in the deep reeds, a bird calls three times. Fast. Alarm.

Thekk Mudwalker is out there somewhere. And Grukka Stillwater will not be returning to camp tonight.

The Bloodswamp Hobgoblins will know. They always know.

state_changes.text: Grukka Stillwater (Bloodswamp clan elder) killed by Thoron in Deep Swamps. Two Bloodswamp leaders now dead. Faction will respond. Alarm raised in reed beds.
